definition-item.definition-title: MACHINES OR EQUIPMENT FOR MAKING OR PROCESSING DOUGHS; HANDLING BAKED ARTICLES MADE FROM DOUGH

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Machines or Equipment, including e.g. hand tools or trays, for preparing, shaping and processing edible dough, namely for mixing, kneading, dividing, working, forming, shaping, cutting, proving, handling the dough before the baking, cooking or prebaking process with optional subsequent freezing.
Machines or equipment, including hand tools, for handling baked or prebaked articles made from edible dough.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dough and dough or bakery products as such, e.g. chemical treatment or recipes
Pasta and noodles as such

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Baker's ovens; machines or equipment for baking
Confectionary
Machines for shaping or working of foodstuff not fully covered by other subclasses, e.g. A21C
Machines for mixing
Machines for packaging articles
Machines for arranging, feeding or orienting biscuits
Transport or storage devices in general
Measuring or metering of fluent solids other than dough by volume

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Dough
is understood to be an edible substance being baked before consumption. The dough can be in a semi-liquid state, e.g. batter, or the dough can be a pasty.

definition-item.definition-title: Mixing or kneading machines for the preparation of dough

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Devices for the mixing and/or kneading of dough, this preparation only concerning the mechanical aspects of it, i.e. the mixing of the individual components to obtain a homogeneous dough and/or its subsequent mechanical kneading to achieve the desired consistency.

In general, methods or devices which are directed to the chemical aspects of dough preparation (e.g. chemical composition, use of specific additives, operating steps intended to modify the properties of the dough—consistency, leavening, development of the mass, preparation for the baking step, etc.) not being directly related to the mixing and/or kneading machine are classified in A21D.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mixing devices in domestic bread preparation machines
Treatment of flour or dough for baking, e.g. by addition of materials; Baking; Bakery products
Domestic mixing or kneading machines
Mixing in general
Mixing or kneading of substances in a plastic state in general

section-body.paragraph-text: In this subgroup, as a general rule, the type of dough mixer is to be specified, as well as the specific structural elements which are characteristic of this kind of device.

Additional details of the mixing or kneading device for which no specific classification information can be found in A21C1/00 are classified under the corresponding sub-groups of B01F (mixing in general).

definition-item.definition-title: Other apparatus for handling dough or dough pieces

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Other apparatus for handling (opposed to shaping or forming) dough or dough pieces in the broadest sense not covered by groups A21C3/00 - A21C7/00 and A21C13/00 - A21C14/00, such as:
Apparatus for conveying, positioning dough or dough pieces or dough carriers, e.g. tins or pans.
Apparatus for filling, e.g. by injection or folding, and apparatus for coating dough pieces, e.g. by brushing on a coating with a sweeping action, and laminating dough sheets.
Other apparatus like hand tools, dust hoods, cleaning arrangements and trays.
